website_summaries.verdict: This expertly constructed countersink drill bit set is proven to deliver fast, precise cuts.
pros: 6-piece countersink drill bit set performs perfectly in conjunction with carbon steel, sheet iron, insulation board, and other hard materials
High-speed steel construction delivers outstanding quality
cons: Drill bits tend to produce chatter and a poor finish when used with a hand drill

customer_reviews.title: It worked.
customer_reviews.text: Did what I needed to do. 8 holes I needed to countersink. Definitely do not limp arm it. Need to make sure that it eats.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: These are complete junk. I’ve never used a worse countersink. There is no back relief grind from the cutting edge, and they chatter like crazy . Check out the 2 photos and see for your self.
customer_reviews.author: ER. Lee

customer_reviews.title: works fine on mild steel.  No chatter in my mill.
customer_reviews.text: I used these initially with a hand drill, got some chatter and overall poor finish. Chucked it up in my bridgeport though and cut some 1045 very smoothly and nice. No chatter, very nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: The 2 Liter

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a Metal Countersink Set
customer_reviews.text: I got the Countersink Drill Bit specifically to make countersinks is angle iron. The bits specifically state for metal and I was a little suspicious they may not work but for only $14 for a set of 6 it was worth the risk. I used the 16.5 mm to make counter sink for 1/4 screws. I was pleasantly surprised when I was able to drill 4 countersinks with reasonable effort to get the depth I needed. I used a battery powered 20V drill at a lower speed. The #14 flat head screw seated perfectly in the countersink.
customer_reviews.author: rkruz

customer_reviews.title: a great tool for rough work
customer_reviews.text: Chatter is hard to control with 3-flute countersinks, so using them results in polygonal holes rather than round holes when used at high speed. Also, standard bolts tend to use 82 degrees rather than 90 degrees. Otherwise, a great tool for rough work.
customer_reviews.author: V R

customer_reviews.title: Good price - - Marginal performance.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the bits chatter pretty bad even in softer materials, low speed/high speed, doesn't much matter... It's hit and miss, but this wasn't a super precision project anyhow, so they worked fine for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chatterific
customer_reviews.text: These chatter a lot making ugly holes even when material is clamped down on a drill press
customer_reviews.author: G-man

customer_reviews.title: nice cutters, chamfer, countersink
customer_reviews.text: these are very sharp an well suited for my work in chamfer, countersink, an hole starter....great little product, will see how long they stay sharp....so far, great
customer_reviews.author: gene

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good used them a limited amount of time but cuts mild steel quite well
customer_reviews.author: Rob Quartermain

customer_reviews.title: Great Metal Countersink Bit Set
customer_reviews.text: This set does exactly its job, you just have to go easy when driving into a hole because they're sharp
customer_reviews.author: Harry C.

customer_reviews.title: Good bits
customer_reviews.text: Good price, work very well. 10/10, I'm happy and would recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan120

customer_reviews.title: Good product and price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for what I brought it for. Delivery was quick and product was exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: These work fine in a milling machine but chatter a bit in a hand drill.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M.

customer_reviews.title: I am completely satisfy, just in time
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfy, just in time, excellent condition well protected package no issues, truly recommended thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Edgard Rosario Maisonet

customer_reviews.title: Nice bits worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bits work great in a drill press, have not had a chance to use in a hand drill. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: TLA

customer_reviews.title: came from china
customer_reviews.text: But what doesn't come from china these days ? so i got the bits the price was cheap seems to work but it took a long time to get here i order it on oct 15 and it came on Dec 3 just about 6 weeks
customer_reviews.author: repair shop

customer_reviews.title: Do not drive it; let it do its own cutting.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the job it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V.

customer_reviews.title: These aren't countersinks, they're end mills
customer_reviews.text: I believe that the seller put 'countersink' in the title for convenience, but they're really end mills, intended to put a 45 degree chamfer on an edge by feeding the tool along it. 90 degrees is not a common countersink angle, screws are 82 deg and deburring is done with a larger angle. Chatter is likely when used as a countersink.
customer_reviews.author: TedC
